title: Fisher Information and Information Geometry
description: Fisher information quantifies the amount of information that observable data carries about unknown parameters in statistical models.
learning_objectives: Compute Fisher information for statistical models
Connect Fisher information to information geometry
Apply Fisher information in Active Inference

content.overview: Fisher information measures the sensitivity of the likelihood function to changes in parameters, quantifying how much information the data provides about unknown parameters. It plays a central role in statistical theory, information geometry, and provides the metric for natural gradient descent.

mathematical_definition.vector_parameter: I(θ) = E[∇_θ log f(X|θ) ∇_θ log f(X|θ)ᵀ]
mathematical_definition.interpretation: Expected curvature of the log-likelihood function
mathematical_definition.properties: Positive semi-definite, additive for independent observations

cramer_rao_bound.interpretation: Fisher information sets fundamental limit on estimation precision

common_misconceptions.misconception: Fisher information is the same as observed information
common_misconceptions.clarification: Observed information is negative Hessian, Fisher is expectation

common_misconceptions.misconception: Higher Fisher information always means better estimation
common_misconceptions.clarification: Depends on the estimator and how information is used

common_misconceptions.misconception: Fisher information is invariant to reparameterization
common_misconceptions.clarification: Changes under nonlinear transformations of parameters
